result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean A. Neumann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr:
Judgment for unpaid court obligations.
Upon payment of restitution, a $5.00 Satisfaction Fee will be required to satisfy judgment.

parties.name: Langlade County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.dispoDesc: This sentence is due to probation being revoked

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dean A. Neumann

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dean A. Neumann in court, in custody with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls 15CM267, 15CM271, 15CM278, 16CM108, 16CT11, 16CM113, 15TR934 & 15TR1039  @ 3:46 pm.   State gives plea agreement, 15CM267, 15CM271, and 15CM278 Sentencing after Revocation 6 months jail, on each cts and all files 16CT11, Plea to ct 1, Ct 2 Dismissed, Fine totaling 1429, 5 days jail, 12 months revocation, alcohol assessment, 16CM108 ct 1 & 2 plea, withheld sentence 2 years probation, AODA, no contact with victim SMJ, Atty Abernethy-Mays heard on contact, Victim rights complied, State would object to DOC determining contact 16CM113 & 16CM108 DRI, Costs on all ct's and DNA surcharge and sample, 1 year IID on 16CT11. Atty Abernethy-Mays agree to plea agreement and so does def. State & Atty Abernethy-Mays both received revocation summary packet.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed. Court questions if def. has been convicted of OWI. State gives reference of 15TR939. This citation are in 16CT11, however charge as OWI 2nd. 15TR934 and 15TR1039 Dismissed. Def. understand charges and penalties 16CT11 OWI 2nd, no contest, 16CM108 Ct 1 & Ct 2 no contest plea.  16CT11 Ct 2 Dismissed and consolidated.  DRI 16CM113. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements. Def. admits prior conviction. Def. admits 3 prior convictions for repeater allegation.  Atty Abernethy-Mays is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  Stipulate to factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty in 16CT11 OWI 2nd in ct 1 &  16CM108 Knowingly Violate Order in ct. 1 and Bailjumping in ct 2 both as repeater. State gives sentencing argument.  Atty Abernethy-Mays gives statement. Def. has nothing to say.  Court orders on 
15CM267 ct 1 6 months jail, 443.00 court costs converted to civil judgment
15CM271 ct 2 6 months jail, concurrent with 15CM267, 443.00  court costs converted to civil judgment
15CM278 Ct 1 6 months jail, concurrent with 15CM267 & 15CM271, 533 court costs converted to civil judgment & 800 Restitution 
138 days credit 20 day in 15CM271, State gives statement 138 days 15CM271, 116 days in 15CM267 & 15CM278.  
16CT11 Ct 1 5 days jail, consecutive to 15CM267, 271 & 278, Fine totaling 1429, includes IID Surcharge,  12 months revocation, 12 months IID, upon application, 200 DNA surcharge but includes in total fine, DNA Sample, State feels no credit, Atty agrees, alcohol assessment and follow through.  All jail sentences huber privileges
16CM108 ct 1  withheld sentence 2 years probation, costs, AODA and follow through, 200 DNA surcharge, Only limited contact with SMJ for visitation of child as allowed and approved by probation agent,  Credit discuss, No credit, reserve right for argument if revoked. 
ct 2 withheld sentence 2 years probation, Same conditions, costs, 200 DNA Surcharge, No credit, Bond applied to costs. 
 If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Def. advised of postconviction rights on all sentences.
DNA Proof of Submission - Filed in 15-CF-233

Defendant Dean A. Neumann in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Defendant Dean A. Neumann in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CM267, 15CM271, 15CM278, 15CF233, 15TR939 @ 9:16 a.m. Agreement stated - 15CM267 plea to ct 1 , ct 2 dismiss and read in, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA and follow through, counseling deemed appropriate, cc,  15TR939 - plea, $937.50, 6 mo revoke, AODA, no IID. 15CM271 - plea to ct 2, ct 1 dismiss and read in, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA and follow through, cc, State wil argue for 20 days jail. 15CM278 plea to charge, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, concurrent, restitution to Covantage $800, counseling deemed appropriate, cc. 15CF233, waive ph, plead to charge without park enhancer. Withheld sentence, 4 yrs probation, AODA follow through, cc, counseling deemed appropriate, State arguing for 6 mo jail consecutive to previous case. Atty Laska and Def agree. 15CF233 - Court reviews prelim waiver. Court accepts waiver as knowing and voluntary. Copy of letter outlining agreement filed. Information filed, copy received. Park enhancer eliminated. 15TR939 - guilty plea. Court finds guilty. $937.50, 6 month revocation retroactive to any admin susp. AODA and follow through. No IID. Court reviews plea quest. 15CM267 ct 1 - guilty plea. 15CM271 ct 2 - guilty plea. 15CM278 - guilty plea. 15CF233 - guilty plea. Consistent with agreement - 15CM267 ct 2 dismissed and read in. 15CM271 ct 1 dismised and read in. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Laska satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 15CM267 ct 1 disorderly conduct, 15CM271 ct 2 misd bail jumping, 15CM278 ct 1 misd theft, 15CF233 ct 1 as amended. Sentencing arguments by Counsel. State has complied with victim rights. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. 15CM267 Court will follow agreement, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA and follow through, counseling as required, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. 15CM271 - withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA, counseling, court costs, 20 days jail. Discussion regarding jail credit, will be calculated if revoked. DNA surcharge. 15CM278 - withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, concurrent, restitution $800 to Covantage, counseling as required, court costs including DNA surcharge. 15CF233 - Court will follow agreement withheld sentence, 4 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, counseling as required, court costs, DNA surcharge, credit for 48 days if revoked. 90 days jail, consecutive to 15CM271, huber on jail time.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def advised of voting and firearms restrictions. Postconviction rights. Jail commences immediately. 15TR939 - pmt plan. $100/month starting when released.

Defendant Dean A. Neumann in court via video, with attorney Cana G Laska.  Defendant Dean A. Neumann in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, reviewed, and waive reading.  Not guilty plea entered.  Court will received not guilty plea.  State request signature bond.  Bond set by court  Status conference scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
